pages.md:
| Problem                  | Solution                                                                                                                                                      |
|--------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| No face is detected.     | - The subjectâ€™s face is obscured by sunglasses, a hat, long hair, or other objects: Remove the obstructions (ðŸ“– 153).                                          |
|                          | - The subjectâ€™s face occupies only a small area of the frame: Change the composition so that the subjectâ€™s face occupies a larger area of the frame (ðŸ“– 153).  |
|                          | - The subjectâ€™s face is turned away from the camera: Ask the subject to face the camera (ðŸ“– 153).                                                              |
|                          | - FACE/EYE DETECTION SETTING is off: Turn FACE/EYE DETECTION SETTING on (ðŸ“– 153).                                                                              |
|                          | - The camera is tilted: Keep the camera level.                                                                                                                |
|                          | - The subjectâ€™s face is poorly lit: Shoot in better light.                                                                                                     |
| No subject is detected.  | - The subject is partially hidden: Choose a vantage point where you can see as much of the subject as possible (ðŸ“– 155).                                       |
|                          | - The subject occupies only a small portion of the frame: Get closer to your subject so it occupies more of the frame (ðŸ“– 155).                                |
|                          | - OFF is selected for SUBJECT DETECTION SETTING: Select SUBJECT DETECTION ON (ðŸ“– 155).                                                                         |
|                          | - The subject is poorly lit: Shoot in better light.                                                                                                            |
| The flash does not fire. | - The flash is disabled: Adjust settings (ðŸ“– 174).                                                                                                             |
|                          | - The electronic shutter is enabled: Choose a SHUTTER TYPE that does not use the electronic shutter (ðŸ“– 170).                                                  |
|                          | - The battery is exhausted: Charge the battery or insert a fully-charged spare battery (ðŸ“– 50).                                                                |
|                          | - The camera is in bracketing or continuous mode: Select single frame mode (ðŸ“– 8).                                                                             |

rows: - The subjectâ€™s face is obscured by sunglasses, a hat, long hair, or other objects: Remove the obstructions (ðŸ“– 153).
- The subjectâ€™s face occupies only a small area of the frame: Change the composition so that the subjectâ€™s face occupies a larger area of the frame (ðŸ“– 153).
- The subjectâ€™s face is turned away from the camera: Ask the subject to face the camera (ðŸ“– 153).
- FACE/EYE DETECTION SETTING is off: Turn FACE/EYE DETECTION SETTING on (ðŸ“– 153).
- The camera is tilted: Keep the camera level.
- The subjectâ€™s face is poorly lit: Shoot in better light.
- The subject is partially hidden: Choose a vantage point where you can see as much of the subject as possible (ðŸ“– 155).
- The subject occupies only a small portion of the frame: Get closer to your subject so it occupies more of the frame (ðŸ“– 155).
- OFF is selected for SUBJECT DETECTION SETTING: Select SUBJECT DETECTION ON (ðŸ“– 155).
- The subject is poorly lit: Shoot in better light.
- The flash is disabled: Adjust settings (ðŸ“– 174).
- The electronic shutter is enabled: Choose a SHUTTER TYPE that does not use the electronic shutter (ðŸ“– 170).
- The battery is exhausted: Charge the battery or insert a fully-charged spare battery (ðŸ“– 50).
- The camera is in bracketing or continuous mode: Select single frame mode (ðŸ“– 8).
